Verses of the Elders🔽The Collection of XIV-Syllable Verses
The First Chapter
The Elder Khadiravaniya Revata
When I went forth
from the home to the homeless life,
I do not recall any thought
unworthy, connected with hatred.
‘May they be killed or slain,
may they be tormented, may they be unhappy’—
I do not recall any such thought
during this long period.

analyzed: mā idtañca abhijānāmi  appamāṇam su bhāvita
translated: I recall having developed🔽immeasurable loving-kindness well,
gradually cultivated,
as taught by the Buddha.
With all as my friend, all as my ally,
compassionate to all beings,
I develop a mind of loving-kindness,
always delighting in non-violence.
I uplift my mind,
unshakable and unbowed,
I develop the divine abode

analyzed: a kāpurisa sevita  a vitakkam samāpannaḥ  sammāsambuddha sāvakaḥ
translated: not frequented by the ignoble.🔽The disciple of the Perfectly Awakened One,
having attained the state free from thought,🔽is then endowed with
the noble silence.
Just as a rock, a mountain
is unshakable and well-established,
so the monk, with the destruction of delusion,
does not tremble, like a mountain.
For a person who is without blemish,
who always seeks to be pure,
Even a hair-tip of evil
appears as large as a cloud.
Just as a border city
is guarded both within and without,
So guard yourselves

analyzed: khaṇaḥ vaḥ māḥ upaccagā  na abhinandāmi maraṇa
translated: lest the moment pass you by.🔽I do not delight in death,
I do not delight in living;
I await the time,
like a hired worker.
I do not delight in death,
… and so on as before …
fully aware and mindful.
The Teacher has been served by me,
the Buddha’s instruction has been done;
The heavy burden has been put down,
the fetters that bound me to existence have been destroyed.
For the sake of which I went forth
from the home to the homeless life,
That purpose has been achieved by me,
the destruction of all fetters.
Accomplish it with heedfulness,
this is my instruction to you;
Now I will attain final Nibbana,
I am completely free from all bonds.”
… the elder Khadiravaniya-Revata …
